author: Anonymous Helix
title: Data definitions for lists
question:
When doing problem 2, I recognized that the start of the function should be:
(@htdf all-course-numbers--course all-course-numbers--loc)
(@signature Course -> ListOfNatural)
(@signature ListOfCourse -> ListOfNatural)
Meaning, the result of the functions was ListOfNatural. 
When doing the problem set I decided to design a data type for ListOfNatural, (which didn't dock any marks in doing so) but in checking the solution, no additional data type was needed. 

If something is a ListOfPrimitiveType, does that mean that the only place it needs to appear is in the signature? No other defining? So, for example, ListOfString would always be a valid result?
student_answer:
The function for this problem is producing a new data type called ListOfNatural so it does not need a data definition.
Functions that consume a ListOfPrimitiveType will need a data definition.
